text: Food is awesome! Service is great! Atmosphere is very nice! I am very glad I tried this place. I will definitely be back. The fish and chips were amazing, the flaming chorizo they bring to the table as a starter was wonderful and wow so was the beef espetada!!!

The food was really good, but the service was very disappointing. We attended the Argentine Tango dance night, so the restaurant was pretty crowded. However, the restaurant only had 1 waitress (who did a good job) for the whole restaurant, but she was the only one, so it took us at least a half hour to get our check, I had to ask twice. Plus they charged us automatic gratuity, so there was little incentive for them to be expedient with their service. Hopefully the service will get better, because the food was pretty good, and the dance event was very nice.

Vila Algarve is a "must eat" place.

My first time, the Caldo Verde really made an impression, and the Bacalau "a Brass" likewise, was a winner.

The tasty food was great enough, but Luby (owner, chef, hostess) made the experience twice as good.

So, two days later, I returned with a friend and we both had a wonderful evening, having Caldo Verde, Portuguese Paella, and carrot cake for dessert.  Again, Luby's authentic good nature came shining through.  As a bonus, we were entertained by the dance lessons while enjoying the food.

Raul

Expected better from all the raving reviews. Two of us got the Paella, we both agreed it tasted liked boxed Spanish rice, chicken on the skewer was dry and tough and the frys with it were just Ore Ida frozen ones. Tried the chicken liver appetizer, this was tasty, but I'm not sure why everyone on this site is raving about the toast, it's actually just white Wonder bread. Took 3 hours for us to get our food, owner did say it would take a while, (claiming it's all fresh made), it's more like they only have to burners on the stove and 1 sauce pan, literally brought out 1 dish then would have to wait 10-15 minutes for someone else's dish (not busy either, only 5 other people there).  Over-rated and more expensive.

When you pull up to the restaurant it doesn't look like much, but one you open the doors and look inside you will be extremely impressed. The atmosphere is amazing and they have a huge dance floor and a variety of dancing on the nights of the week. The restaurant is family owned and the customer service is amazing. The food is different but there's something for everyone and it's delicious. Order the escargot or they have the same thing with shrimp instead of snails and it's just to die for!
Amazing Portuguese food! Linguica (chirizo) is unique and very yummy. Must try the curry. The owner is very friendly. We were treated like her family!

This is a fun place to go. The owner bubbles with enthusiasm and will be very happy to discuss her dishes as much as you like. Our party of four had pig ears, chicken Algarve (thin chicken filet with cheese and mushrooms and spices, baked chicken, and chicken on a shish kabob; the first chicken dish and the pig ears were the best in terms of flavors. Unfortunately, they were out of the Portuguese Chorizo and we didn't try any of the more exotic dishes. Everyone liked everything. I plan to go back and try some of their seafood dishes. 

I notice reviews cover the spectrum on the Sangria. The owner asked us if we would like a liter of Sangria which is a tad more than quart. We're not big drinkers and we hesitated. The owner assured us it was a light drink; she said she just put a little port wine in and no Vodka; she acted like making Sangria with Vodka was very unauthentic. So the four of us shared a liter of Sangria. The Sangria tastes good but I judged the alcohol content to be substantially less than that of a typical red wine. So order the Sangria if you would like a light alcohol drink with great flavor and order wine if you want something with more bite. 

When we ordered, the owner told us that one of the dishes would take at least 35 minutes since it was being made from scratch. We were up for a leisurely Sunday evening meal with good company so that was not a problem for us and spent about an hour and twenty minutes there. Of course, if you are on a tighter schedule, ask what can be prepared fast. 

Service was attentive without the waitresses introducing themselves and announcing that they would be taking care of us that evening. I prefer it that way.  

I decided on five stars based the pig ears and chicken Algarve, nice atmosphere, leisurely but attentive service and a modest bill: $59 for the four us with tax but before the tip and there was more than enough food.

Went last night and had a fantastic Portuguese meal. The food is as good or  better than my Mother and Grandmother Portuguese cooking. As a 1st generation Portuguese born in the states I give this place 5 stars.... The owner spoke to us and we love her... Food is great !!!! please all Portuguese and Brazilian please try it you will love it... FORCA PORTUGAL!!!!!

Amazing place and amazing food, the paella it's delicious and I also recommend the sangria, last time we ate tapas and we just could stopping ordering more and more. Very fresh and delicious!

Maravilhoso Ambiente e comida, a paella estava deliciosa, e também a sangria. Ultima vez que viemos comemos tapas e não conseguimos parar de pedir mais e mais. A comida é deliciosa!
Fantastic service, excellent food and the owner personally comes out to make sure your dining experience is flawless. Came here while visiting my parents and was not disappointed.
The best in Vegas!I love this place! Fun, fun, fun!Thank you!

This was my worst dining experience. The service was bad. Our food didn't all come at the same time. Each dish came every 15 to 20 minutes. The food was overpriced. They charged us twice the corking fee they said they would. I would not recommend this at all. The ambiance is horrible.

My worst dining experience ever. Very ordinary food. And that is being kind. Over priced food. Horrible service. The owner lied about several things. I had to ask for bread for the table. 10 minutes later the owner showed up with a basket of what seem like microwaved roles that she probably bought for the grocery store next door. The fish was unseasoned. The salad DID NOT have dressing on it. The surf and turf was tasteless and had only 3 shrimps and badly cooked meat that was tough. We will never set foot in this place ever again. 1 star is a high rating for this place.

I don't understand these reviews. The service was fine, very friendly, but the food was off.

1) The sauce for the appetizers were extremely salty. We all had different appetizers, and they were all outrageously salty.  I picked my food out of the sauce to eat it. 

2) Lamb shank was good, not great. Grilled vegetables that accompanied it were cooked nicely however. White rice...was white rice. 

 I was excited for this evening, expecting big flavor profiles. I also want to support local businesses. Instead I ended up with a rather mediocre meal. Certainly not worth the final bill. Yelp really let me down on this one.

Excellent food! Tried it out for the first time and was surprised how good everything here is. The owner walked us through her menu and is clear how much pride she takes in her recipes. The shrimp curry and paella were incredible. Don't miss this place just off the strip.
This is a very unquie and inviting place to be. It has a lot of character and very nice to enjoy the people as well. The food also is so different and alot of special things on the menu also.
Awesome place to eat, hang out and dance! They have amazing food and consistent dance parties throughout the week.

The food is delicious - traditional Portuguese with a Bulgarian flavor.  The codfish is exactly the way my Portuguese grandpa used to make.  

The ambiance is casual, with a large dance floor in the middle and a live band playing soft music.  The band is very talented, and gives a pleasant jazz vibe. 

The owner is very attentive and friendly.  She went out of her way to cook something not on the menu for my picky daughter.  Overall, this was a wonderful dinner experience.  Don't let the location dissuade you, this restaurant is worth a visit and many return visits.
Just had lunch here today. The service was great. Tried a new dish of octopus and rice were delicious. The sangria was also very good. The caldo verde soup was also wonderful.
The food here is amazing and the staff was so nice. The atmosphere is great and I highly recommend it for any occasion!

Bad news first: This isn't authentic Portuguese food.  The owners aren't Portuguese, put kielbasa in the "caldo verde," and don't know how to spell bacalhau (or bras, or quite a few other Portuguese words...).  The kielbasa bit actually bothers me because they claim that it's real Portuguese chorizo. But I guess most Americans don't go to most "Chinese" restaurants wanting to eat authentic Chinese food, either.  
The staff are mostly eager to please (even if you expect them to really give you free drinks--this is a restaurant that's in it to make money.  They do want you to pay for that caparinha they said they were going to "give" you, if at the Happy Hour price.).  The restaurant is physically pleasant, and the food is decent, maybe even good if you don't know any better.    Just don't get too carried away with your fantasy that the food you're eating bears much resemblance at all to what you'd get in Portimao or Albufeira.
What a delightful meal.! The food was delicious, cooked to order. We had no room for desert. What  wonderful Owners & Server. It was interesting to taste Portuguese food (a menu to fit anyone )
Very nice lamb shank, lobster and scallop. Will go another day for sure

I am Portuguese and grew up with nothing but Portuguese food. The food is spot on to what I grew up with. Very good. The sangria was AMAZING and the chourico was amazing. Food gets 5 starts. The service was great. The owner herself took our order and served us and we chatted about being Portuguese. The only down side is the food is a little pricey but it's def worth is.

I was excited to see this restaurant close to my work.  The owner was very nice and personally greeted and seated me at the 
bar.  I would give it 3.5 stars if possible. 

I had Sopa Verde which is a Portuguese kale/potato/chorizo soup.  It was very good.  I then ordered what I thought was the calamari entre with fries, and got calamari with rice.  It was ok, but IMO needed some salt and pepper as it was a tad bit flat.  

I also ordered Vino Verde, which is a tart Portuguese white wine.  When the check arrived, I was invoiced for the calamari appetizer vs entre which saved some $.  A complaint was that the vino verde was 7 per glass.  That seemed very high, as this wine is tupically one that is in the 6-9$ / bottle range, so felt that was very excessive.  Also I yearned for bread which was not offered.  

I will for sure return, as I think that some if the glitches could be attributed to it recently opening.  The menu is very interesting.

Wow!  My wife and I kept putting off going Vila Algarve to eat because of the mixed reviews, we are very sad that we put it off. We lived in the Azores for 19 months and are very familiar with Portuguese food, we were not disappointed by the experience. First of all we were greeted at the door by Luby and shown to a great table. Our server did a great job of explaining things on the menu and pointed us in the right direction. We started out with a bottle of Vinho Verde and two appetizers; halloumi cheese and grilled calamari.  What a great start!  For our entree, we shared the Bacallau Assado and the grilled scallops. The cod fish was amazing with a little drizzle of balsamic vinegar and the scallops we the best I have ever had. Seriously, the scallops were like butter they were so rich and delicate. For desert we shared the flour less walnut chocolate cake and coffees (meia de leite and espresso). Everything was fresh and delicious. The service was stellar. More people owe it to themselves to try the amazing restaurant. Do not expect fast, American style food. This is pretty authentic Portuguese/European style dining. Slow down and enjoy Vila Algarve, you will be glad you did!

Amazing food, fantastic service, in a very clean and comfortable environment.  This is a new restaurant just a few blocks west of the strip, in the Spring Valley area.  The first bite of my lunch made me stop and look around.  I didn't know where that perfect balance of flavor was coming from.  Every bite was enjoyable and the only sad point is when I was done and couldn't keep eating.  The service was very caring, which is so rare in the food service industry today.  Lastly, the milieu is clean, slightly upscale without becoming pretentious, and complements the food and service perfectly.  You would be comfortable coming to this restaurant in flip flops and a tee, or dressed to the nines.  If you try it out because of my recommendation, please let me know what you thought!  Thanks for reading :)
Absolutely outstanding and unusual food. Lamb shank was marinated for 12 hours and wad exquisite. Small appetizer was the best...size was to die for.

Amazing food!  Everything was excellent. A great mix of traditional Portuguese food with some French flare (mainly the sauces).  The escargot (snails) is the best I have ever had and I have been to France. They are served with a white sauce with some cheese mixed in - a nice shift from . The chorizo is also fantastic. For the main course, the lamb shank was "to die for."  If you like lamb, get this.  It fell apart with a smooth buttery texture and topped with an amazing sauce. Finally the marscapone desert was the perfect ending to a wonderful dinner. 

This is the food we had in Vegas. It far beats anything in the strip.  Make the short drive and enjoy a reasonably priced wonderful meal. 

Service is warm and attentive, like being a visitor at someone's home. Decor and atmosphere are simple. The food is the focus and it's amazing.
Lovely service and food. Neighborhood gem. The paella was fantastic as was the grilled skewer of beef. Staff was very attentive and helpful.

I had the most amazing lunch today. I tried a new restaurant, Vila Algarve. Not only was the food amazingly presented. It tasted even more amazing. Half Chorizo as a starter was served in a flaming dish. It was delicious. I had the Chicken Espetada (12 oz. marinated chicken) served on the skewer; this was the tenders' most flavorful chicken I have ever had! My partner had the Beef Espetada(12 oz. marinated beef) medium rare equally tender and flavorful.
Our server was attentive and very helpful. The décor gave you the feel of being in a Portugal bistro . The owners Luby & Linden are extremely  personal and accommodating. They have a full bar with great prices. Comfortable seating both inside and outside. There is even a stage area. The clean open atmosphere  is very inviting. Prices are very affordable. A great place for a romantic date or a family gathering.

Absolutely the best!!!! If there's only one restaurant you try in Las Vegas make it VilaAlgarve!!!!! Hostess and staff were exceptional!!!!!! If I have to say anything negative is they do not take AE, but not an issue for me!!!! Can't wait to come back to Vegas for some more authentic portuguese food!!!! VIVA PORTUGAL!!!!!

Horrible. 

If you want to pay for a thimble of rum served to you in a tiny shot glass yet having your liquor charged serpately from the soda in the glass this is the type of place for people not sophisticated in the art of being conned.

If you want your order to arrive before you are boyfriends or girlfriends and you don't mind eating your meal alone and if you don't mind that they put onions on things you tell them not to and if you don't mind looking at a very scared of waitress who appears as though she is going to be reprimanded by the disgruntled owners  for making a mistake and you don't mind sitting in a 95 degree room then this is the place for you but not for me also v the French fries were frozen but cooked but they were the frozen kind as well as the dinner bread rolls which came from a package at the local supermarket so once again if you like a frugal meal and a hot environment and pay for every extra you'll enjoy this place not for me.

If you like that they fall back on not knowing English when you order Bicardi and they bring you captain morgan and tell you that the bill says both Captain Morgan and yes it shows bicardi, but they don't carry bicardi but the computer too prints it out as bicardi enjoy your stay.  Finally when you ask for your check receipt because you realized they are going to over charge and over bill you guess what., they get upset and question why you want you receipt not only by the cashier, but also the owner.

Never again. I would have left 1 star but the food was almost edible and I felt bad for the waitress.
If I could give negative stars I would. Sat for two hours. Food was terrible. Dry ashy food with no service of any kind. Many of the people we were with, DIDNT EVER get their food and had to leave.

I love the snails dish ( sounds weird but don't be hesitate to try !). It was so  yummy. My husband really like the chorizo sausage. Chicken curry was good too with a nice consistency taste throughout the whole dish. Price was good , portion was good. Service was good. We will definitely be back.

This place is a gem. We had the Portuguese sausage, snails, algarve shrimp,  chicken liver and paella. For dessert we had Mascarpone with French vanilla ice cream. Service was excellent will definitely recommend and will be back.

We've been to Vila Algarve a few times. Its ALWAYS delicious and unique meals with exceptional service. We love talking to the owner and hearing about the menu. We had Grilled Organic Spring Chicken last night and again it was fantastic. We will be back!

Purchased a groupon for a 4 course seafood dinner for 2. Made our reservation for 4pm. We were the only ones in the restaurant but it was nice because Luby (sp?) and her staff were so attentive to us. She knew exactly who we were when we walked in and that we were having the 4 course meal. while we were there, there was a group of dancers practicing a dance for an event the next evening, so it was kind of cool getting dinner and a show. She said they have dance nights where diners can dance to salsa and other types of music.

She recommended that since we got our own choice for each course, that she just brings out one of each course option so we could try everything. I'm SO glad we did! Our first course was soup/salad. The soup was so delicious and the salad was simple but refreshing. She also recommended her house sangria, she told us she makes it herself so of course we had to try it. Now i'm not a drinker and i don't like wine, but this stuff was SOOOOO GOOOOD. it wasn't tart at all, it was perfectly sweet without being too sweet. it may be one of the top reasons i would visit again! after the soup and salad she brought out a plate of dolmares (rice stuffed grape leaves) and a plate of chorizo. they were delicious as well. our main seafood course was some grilled shrimp, calamari and some sort of fish, with a lemon garlic butter sauce and rice pilaf. holy cow, this seafood is to die for. the fish was perfectly moist, the squid wasn't chewy and the shrimp..... my boyfriend hates eating shrimp but he was bartering his fish for my shrimp pieces. the sauce was amazing. i'm salivating just thinking about the rice and fish with the sauce, it's so good! for the last course, she brought us baklava. my boyfriend had never had it before and he wasn't too sure about it, but after we each had a few bites he was asking if he could finish it. the food was great, the drinks were great and the service was wonderful.

i've never tried Portuguese food before this, and you can tell she makes everything with her heart and soul. Luby (sp?) was such a sweetheart to us, even when my boyfriend accidentally broke a wine glass and spilled sangria all over the floor and her leather chair! i have told so many people already about this place and i will be back here again to try her other dishes!
Wonderful food and excellent service. This was my 1st having Portuguese Food. I will definitely be back again

We went here because it is close to where we live. We we pleasantly surprised with the evening. We started with the chorizo. It was great as was the homemade sauce it came with. I had the scallops, which were large and perfectly cooked, very tender. My husband had the beef espetada, and it was amazing. Well cooked, the marinade was perfect. Our waitress was very helpful and it is a restaurant that I would recommend.

What a find! We had just arrived in Vegas for a short trip and this place was within walking distance of where we stayed. It's off the strip but worth getting there. The soup (leek) was outstanding. Very memorable. We also had the mussels in cream sauce and we were so pleasantly surprised! So tasty. You would think you would pay a lot more than you do for the quality here. The place even has dance events! But it's the owners that make this place! They were so kind to us and we felt like family when we left.  We will definitely be back when we're in town!

Try sangria and snails that's so delicious!
Fresh, tasty and well cooked food. Clean, new and high quality restaurant.

Absolutely hidden gem, had the kale soup for starters was fabulous. The sangria delicious.  On to the half chicken grilled to perfection is right cooked perfect.  Sauted squash carrots medley perfect again.  Sorry i waited this long to try Vila Algarve.. will be back soon , was lucky to have had Luby owner as our serververy attentive and explained menue in great detail.

We went here on a Sunday evening and enjoyed a 4 course meal starting with salad and domidas. We had the empanada meal with chicken that was wonderfully presented. The ambiance was excellent with a singer doing tunes from the 50s and 60s, I believe.  They have a dance floor that you can partake of and the service was excellent. Thoroughly enjoyed dinner with my husband and will return when in Vegas.  They also had salsa classes on Sunday evening. A beautiful experience was provided.

First time trying Portugese food and it was delicious. My wife had the snails and I had the chicken liver appetizers. Both were great with delicious sauces. I had the Paella and my wife had the Mozambique shrimp curry. Another set of great dishes. Our host and waiter were funny and provided great service along with recommendations for food and drinks. The Salsa classes were a nice attraction as well. If you want a great dining experience off the strip this is a nice relaxing place. Dont forget to try the Rakia and their delicious house special Sangria.

Growing up in Hawaii, the only thing I knew of Portuguese cuisine were Portuguese sausage (linguisa), Portuguese sweet bread (pan duce), and of course Malasadas (sugar-coated fried dough) from Leonard's. So, when I found a Portuguese restaurant (the only one in Vegas) on Yelp! I was intrigued and immediately bookmarked it. My Brother and his friend were in town, so, I thought it would be the perfect opportunity to check this place out...

Vila Algarve is located on the corner of Trop & Jones alongside the Smith's, facing Jones (big 'ol sign, can't miss it). The first thing you notice when you walk in is that their dining room tables surround a pretty big dance floor (dancing? Um, no). The waiter led us to our table and took our drink order...everyone else, Sangria...me, I've always wanted to try a Caipirinha. A Portuguese cocktail with sugarcane syrup,lime, and a shot of either rum, vodka, or tequila...made mine a virgin (don't drink alcohol anymore). Waiter brought it to me with a shot of vodka anyway, was like a lemon-lime slush, quite refreshing. Everyone else raved about the Sangria.

The owner came out to greet us and asked if we had any questions about the menu and then explained the way some of the dishes were prepared, which she really took a lot of pride in...the menu had a lot of great sounding foods to choose from, frog legs? Snails anyone? No? There were four of us, so we went family-style and chose a couple of apps and shared a couple of Main dishes. We started with the grilled Halloumi cheese, never had grilled cheese (except a grilled cheese sandwich ). It was served with a Piri-piri sauce (a kind of chili sauce, more spicy than hot) for dipping, super delicious. Next up was the Portuguese Chorizo, which was presented to us in a flaming ceramic pig and sliced up table side. Awesome char and flavor...I wanted to take that pig grill home! Then came the Dolmades  (Rice stuffed grape leaves) and the grilled Calamari. Both amazing, the Dolmades had a Gorgonzola (I think...)cheese sauce that took it over the top and calamari was prepared perfectly.

On to the main courses, the wife ordered the grilled Sea Bass...served with a buttery cream sauce and grilled veggies. Best sea bass I've ever had, the wife loved it too. My brother ordered the Algarve potatoes...very flavorful fried potatoes topped with a very cheesy and creamy mushroom sauce, superb. My brother's friend got the chicken curry, it was yellow coconut milk curry, no heat, but with a lot of flavor. It was also served with the awesome piri-piri sauce on the side for added spiciness. As if we weren't getting full enough, I had to order the Seafood Paella...which I believe was the the best dish of the night, the saffron rice mixed with peas, bell peppers, onions, chicken chunks, chorizo, and mussels and huge prawns...soooo good! Had to skip dessert because of that, ah well next time.

So, what have we learned...Portuguese food is more than Malasadas. The dishes have a lot of Spanish / Mediterranean influences. Piri-piri sauce and the Sangria is bomb...and my wife will never try frog legs or snails.

Vila Algarve has great food, service and staff...my wife might come back for the free dance lessons...me, I'll be back for dessert.

Excellent food and The price is very good. The owner is part Portuguese and that part knows how to cook.

Bacalhau assado was my choice. Very good and not salty. We had an appetizer which was shrimp and cheese melted. Very good as well. A little distant, but worth the way.

They have an amazing dance floor and have dance shows. Tango, salsa, ballroom dances. Very cool.

Traveled to Las Vegas with my family for my cousins wedding, and being Portuguese we HAD to stop here to eat. My goddness, we are so glad we did! The owner, Luby, has a very warm heart, and loves what she does. We were greeted with open arms, and given stories from her ancestors, and shared our own. My parents ordered escargot, linguica, and calle verde as appitizers. My sister and I had never had escargot, and geez.... it was delicious. The sauce was outstanding!! We will definitely be coming back on future trips, and possibly even before we leave!

This was my first time trying portuguese food and i was far from disappointed! We started with the soup of the day (kale and chorizo) which was so smooth and rich, no bitterness from the kale at all. We also ordered the seafood pasta, which was dressed with a delicious white sauce that was not heavy or too creamy. All the seafood was fresh and full of flavor! The wait for food was a little long, but worth the wait for sure. Would recommend the calamari and pasta. Great cuisine and service.

We are visiting from Houston and just had to try Vila Algarve. I'm Portuguese so I have to say I was skeptical since I've been disappointed with other places. Well Vila Algarve is the real deal. Home cooking that reminds me of mom's and grandma's cooking. Very authentic and excellent flavors. Everything was very fresh. We had the caldo verde, chorizo, and paella. All amazing!!! The owner, Luby, was a sweetheart and made us feel like family. Excellent customer service. The home made sangria was also good. We will definitely be coming back next time we visit. I hope to see this place grow.

Stopped in here for dinner recently. I'd just say I'd never return. I don't understand how this place as a 5 star rating based off the food & service I ate/received. Service was horribly slow & there was only about 5 other people in the large dining room. They kept saying it will be slow because "everything is made to order." Well we would all hope that most restaurants we visit make our food to order rather than from a box. Fast food we expect from a box not food at a sit down restaurant. Tried the snails & they were covered in some heavy creamy white sauce (which I realize the menu stated) & could not taste nothing but creamy white sauce. Also tried the chicken Livers & chicken Gizzards. Liver was so so. It should have been soaked in milk longer to remove the liver taste. Gizzard just tasted like beef stew. I used to work in a venue that cooked the chicken lives, gizzards & hearts & I actually liked them - didn't have the gross taste that most places do as they were prepared correctly & seasoned just perfectly. Tried a chicken appetizer & it was just plain. Tried the chorizo & honestly tasted like stuff I've grilled before. Wasn't worth the $6.50 for it. Ordered the pork kabob & pork was so over cooked & dry. Only parts that were any decent were the parts that had a bit of fat on it so it gave it a bit of moisture. Honestly I make better pork at home. There was not even any Portuguese seasoning on the pork. Plate had steamed green peppers, onions & carrots with it that were over cooked & mushy instead of tender crisp. I do have to say at least the seasoning on the veggies made them edible even if they were mushy. French fries or plain white rice came with the dish as well. Opted for the french fries as plain white rice is not appealing to me. Fries tasted like they were from the freezer section at the local grocery store. Their saving grace was they were hot from the fryer so the salt stuck to them when I salted them. Music was much too loud we had to shout at each other. Sadly I really don't have much good to say about this place & unfortunately based on my dining experience I would never return.

Not a great place,I had Dolmades which were good,I had Chicken livers which were terrible over cooked and tough and had an off taste to them(great chicken livers @ Jerry's Nugget)not able to eat them & I had the Scallops which were borderline a little over cooked @ $17.99 way over priced for that place and only 5 or 6 scallops any way my total for 3 apps was$38.90 The server was very nice the place itself was very cold and the dancers were not enjoyable to watch.

Given that my parents are from Madeira Island, I was super excited to find this amazing restaurant. Lubi took care of us, as well as her very attentive wait staff. The food was amazing. Since I had never tried a pizza with Portuguese spices, I chose this for my entry. It was delicious and minus the greasiness of many pizzas. My boyfriend ordered the meat on the skewer which reminded me of family barbeque's from my childhood. If you want an authentic Portuguese dining experience, I highly recommend that you try Vila Algarve.
During dinner hour we were the only patrons, while we were there no other customers came in. Below average service. No serving spoons for dishes. Not even a water refill. Food okay not the greatest.

Amazing food! Luby and her staff did everything possible to make our visit memorable. We started off with some delicious Sangria and the flaming chorizo. Phenomenal! Then my hot date and I tried the escargot. Amazing! For the main course I had the Paella and she finally settled on the cury chicken. Satisfying food that will make anyone happy. We are looking forward to going back next time in town.
Absolutely incredible food and Luby is a class act and one of the best restaurant hosts I have ever witnessed.

The cuisine in this restaurant is not nor ever was Portuguese cuisine!  Being Portuguese I was shocked and mortified when the food arrived at our table.  I keep praying and hoping that someone will open a true "Portuguese Cuisine" restaurant in Las Vegas.
Great food with one of the best service in a restaurant. I hope this place doesn't change it's attention to detail and the authentic cooking

Food is awesome here and the owner is very friendly. I ordered a chorizo and grape leaves. They were full of flavor, but easy on the spices. The dishes complimented each other very well and I would ordered it again.

I shall start this as clear as I can...if you have not been here...YOU ARE A FOOL! I married Portuguese and outside of my mother in law's house, I have never felt so welcomed, at home and part of a family. Luby, the owner, personally welcomes you to her 'home'. With a smile and personal care.

The food, AMAZING! I'm a linguica junkie and whether you call it linguica or chorizo, it has to be the BEST I've ever had (sorry to my Portuguese family).

Whether it's seafood, chicken, pork, beef or just vegetables the food, the atmosphere, the experience and the feeling that mom is making dinner just for you only falls short of mom actually making dinner just for you.

Kisses and hugs to Luby and the gang at Vila Algarve. I'm so happy to have found a place to call home being so new to Las Vegas.

found this nice little Portuguese restaurant and the food was delicious tried the soup it was a large bowl of Caldo Verde ( Potato, kale & Chlorizo )  Then I had the seafood Pasta , It had Plenty of calamari, A couple of nice chunks of Lobster, some Mussels & Clams in a cream sauce  with a couple of cans of soda & the price was under $30. the food was not cheap but it was delicious with large portions well worth the price. & Luby the owner was very nice will be coming back again.

I came for happy hour. The place was empty. The women who served me I think might have owned the place. She let me taste the sangria they make there. It was very good. I just wasn't really in the mood to drink. So I had water. She brought a bottle water but I noticed it wasn't on the bill. So that was very nice. I tried the happy hour menu. Everything on it is $5.99. I had the snails, halloumi cheese, mini espetadas, and the battered cod. It was all very good. My favorite was the cod. The batter was so crispy and flaky on the outside and the fish on the inside was so soft it melted in your mouth. It came on a bed of creamy rice. At first I thought it was risotto. Then I thought it might be grits. So then I asked her and she said it was rice. I was almost tempted to lick the plate it tasted so good. It complimented the cod quite nicely. My least favorite thing I tried was the halloumi cheese. Tasted like string cheese to me that you didn't string to eat. I probably wouldn't order it again. It came with a spicy red sauce that she told me they make it there from scratch. It was pretty good. I also had the snails which were covered in melted butter and came with some toast. Tasted very similar to shrimp. I would probably get those again. And the mini espetadas was delicious. It was white meat chicken on a skewer with a very tiny salad on the plate. The salad didn't have any dressing. The chicken was the juiciest white meat chicken I've ever tasted. You could just see the juices falling out of it. I normally don't like white meat because every time I eat it it is dry, but not this chicken. I would definitely recommend trying it. Especially if you are a fan of white meat chicken to begin with. I had great service, afterall I was the only person in there. And my check came with a mint which was nice. I'll definitely be coming back. 5 stars for service and food!

My family is from the Azores, faial and terceira, we wanted to try this as it's the only Portuguese restraunt in Vegas. We tried about 7 different dishes, every single one was delicious! The owner, luby, opened the place to bring the Las Vegas Portuguese community together.  A must try!   Lubys homemade sangria is delicious!  See all my fellow portagees there!

Hole in the wall from the outside, fantastic Portuguese food and service that treats you like you're family- Vila Algarve is so much more than I expected! Tucked away in an odd strip mall, the space has a bar and a dining room with a dance floor, live music and dance lessons, and some seriously bomb food.

HOUSE BREAD & SPREAD: Rolls are freshly oven-warmed and crisp, yogurt-eggplant spread is like a light version of babaghanoush, really tasty.
HOUSE MADE CHORIZO: Nicely seasoned with a little bit of spice, you gotta get this for the presentation: served flaming and cut tableside from a pig-shaped plate that is equal parts cute and tasty. Almost didn't get this but glad we did.
GRILLED HALLOUMI: Squeaky cheese with a spicy-zesty dipping sauce. I can't say I'm too familiar with this kind of cheese, and it seems best eaten before it cools too much, but I enjoyed trying this.
SNAILS: Different preparation than usual, served in a cream sauce with cheese and toast, but still quite a tasty way to enjoy these critters. Ask for extra bread, portion is larger than expected and very saucy. I'm a sucker for the more common garlic-wine sauce preparation but was pleased with this version!
GRILLED SARDINES: BF's pick. he loved them, I would have rather opted for the calamari. Served with grilled peppers, onions, and garlic, a quartet of petite grilled fish were served in a sea of olive oil. Add some of the table balsamic to brighten up the flavors a bit.
SEAFOOD PAELLA: Sharable $30 portion with three large shrimp, a few mussels, squid, chorizo, and chicken, with a soft saffron rice with only a slight bit of spice. Great version of a favorite dish, would get again.
CHOCOLATE CAKE: BF insisted on dessert, this cake had a nicely balanced flavor that wasn't too sugary. Unfortunately this seems to be kept refrigerated (and perhaps at too low of a temperature), resulting in an odd dryness throughout. This is served with fresh whipped cream.

Food was delightful, service was incredibly personable- one lovely lady was handling all four dinnertime tables, assisted by two staff. Meal was a leisurely pace, dishes were appropriately coursed, and by the end of our meal we were making notes for our selections for our next visit and hugging the owner as we walked out the door. A neighborhood gem. 

TIP: On Wednesdays and/or Thursdays they have live music and various dance lessons/groups, including salsa and swing.

Yum!

I discovered this restaurant through Meetup.

Drink(s): Caipirinha and a shot of the red Sangria to taste
Appetizer: Soup of the Day = Caldo Verde
Entree: Paella - Portugese Style
Dessert: Algarve Mascarpone Roll

The cocktail was so refreshing with the perfect amount of sweet adding tiny bits of lime and lemon in finely blended ice.  As I had to drive home immediately afterwards, I was offered a shot of Lubey's homemade Sangria which is now on my to-drink list when I return for their nightly dancing classes.

The soup of the day was a very tasty kale soup perfected with so much flavor.  If you don't order anything else, you must try this soup. Yum!

Paella is mostly a seafood dish atop saffron rice.  You'll get shrimp, calamari, mussels, chorizo sausage,and chicken flavored to perfection slow cooked with green bell peppers, onions, peas, and tomatoes.

The Mascarpone Roll was a perfect ending - a fluffy ball of vanilla ice cream atop "three turning fan blades" of mascarpone and dotted with fresh blueberries and blueberry sauce.

This restaurant deserves time in your schedule.  Cheers!

I'm giving it 2 stars cause the food was pretty good but the portions were super small and over priced. 
The restaurant was empty on a Saturday night which was really weird. 
The worst thing about this place was the Owner Lady/Waitress.  She was flipping the menu for us while we asked her to give us time to decide and was extremely pushy about what to order like she was the one having dinner instead of us  
This put my boyfriend in such a bad mood and gave us an headache,  imagine how pressured we fell with their eyes on us while deciding what to eat,  considering the place was also empty...*crickets*
There goes our romantic dinner. 
I'd suggest bigger portions for the price paid, real bread instead of a Multigrain slice of toast and have the lady back off when guests are still deciding.

My family and I decided to celebrate my birthday at Villa Algarve in Las Vegas and we absolutely loved it. 

We started with a homemade Sangria and it was amazing. 'The Caldo Verde' (green soup) & 'Flamed Chorizo' were also spectacular. Snail Escargots were out of this world! I have never tried them before, so I was a little afraid of ruining my appetite, but no regrets.

As my entrée, I decided on the 'Bacalhou  Asado' (grilled cod fish) which was delicious (I have never had it grilled). My husband enjoyed the Paella, my oldest had the beef espetada, second oldest tried the lamb shank and my youngest chose ribeye steak over eggs and ham. Nothing that was brought to us was short of spectacular.

The owner was also our hostess and she made sure we felt at home. Her service and attention to detail was as spectacular as the food was; she also complimented the amazing experience with a delicious shot from her home country for the entire family in celebration of my birthday. I can't thank her enough.

I highly recommend Vila Algarve to everyone. You will not be disappointed!!! I can not wait to soon return.

This restaurant is delightfully enchanting. It doesn't look like much from outside, but step in the door and you'll feel as though you've just stepped into a 5 star restaurant. The owners are extremely friendly and treat you like family from the moment you arrive introducing themselves with a friendly smile and warm hug. The food is exceptional and underpriced for it's worth. I absolutely love this place and would recommend to anyone willing to take a chance on an unassuming night out with a loved one...even better they have live musical talent. Love it.

Haven't had such delicious  Portuguese food since my last visit to Portugal. The owner is wonderful. She makes you feel right at home. Everything is made to order. My new favorite spot. Will definitely come back on my next visit to Las Vegas.

I read about Villa Algarve on Yelp, when I was looking for an interesting place we had not been before with great food... Well this is it! 

Unique look when you walk in. Large dance floor, band set up at the end of the room & tables around the dance floor. No band when we were there, but we were told they do ballroom dancing, Salsa, Tango & have instructors available. Sounds Fun!!!

Luba is the owner & she came over to go thru the menu with us. We ordered some home-made Sangria and  a reasonably priced red wine which she recommended.  Both were very good & easy to recommend. 

Luba went thru the starters menu & she was really generous with her time and gave us some great information about each starter. We ordered so many starters that we decided to just do that first & see if we were full after eating those. 

We started with the flaming piggy dish in the pic. The Portuguese Chorizo sausage which was being seared by the flame was crisp & flavorful, with a home-made sauce which was very acidic and interesting. We all shared it & everyone liked it. 

Next came the snails in cheese.  Such large snails drenched in a wonderful white cheese sauce. We had a good fight over this fish. Soooo good!

Octopus... We stretched our minds & tried this at Luba's urging.  It was very, very tasty. It disappeared quickly. 

Toasted Goat cheese.  Wow Wow Wow. I can still taste it & it make me want to go back soon. 

We did not love the kale soup... Luba said a lot of people do.  Kale is an acquired taste for sure.  It is a little bland in my opinion. Tastes healthy.

Gargantuan Oyster... Mild, sweet and SO FRESH! You will have to cut some of them into pieces. Not kidding! These oysters are HUGE! 

Deserts. We tried the chocolate cake... Really good. It disappeared.  Baclava with ice cream. We ordered extra ice cream & enjoyed it with both dishes & alone. 

Go check out this restaurant. The prices are reasonable & the food is great. Service is Like being at home. Luba & her staff are so kind & helpful & in general it is fun, unique & a great time!

Second time around for us, Luby & the staff made us feel like family. The food there is just beyond excellent, easy to get to from the strip by bus, If I could give 10 stars instead of five I would, We live in Washington State so there is no Portuguese Rest there, Made me feel like home again. I noticed that the low star reviews are from the locals there & Don't really know about European food ,Thank you again Luby keep up the great work there, see you soon again.

BTW This restaurant is no longer a Portuguese restaurant and that was why we came.  Showed up and it was empty and they are having Salsa night.  We are literally the only people here.  Ordered food but some items not available.  Was told they have changed owners.  Decided to stay and make an adventure of it and see how the food is.  Staff are very pleasant hopefully the food is good too.   Two star for now bc first two items ordered were not available but staff was nice.....update...food is not bad moved it to three stars bc of the staff really.

Amazing food!!!! Unique for sure. The owner knows her stuff and did a super job explaining the foods and even picked a wine that was absolutely delicious !!!! Couldn't ask for better service.  You MUST try this outstanding restaurant!

Another new business that I just couldn't wait to open. Vegas kind of lacks in Portuguese restaurants so when I noticed that Vila Algarve was opening up I had to go. It's located in the old Sushi Factory spot in a plaza on the NW corner of Tropicana and Jones. It's a very spacious place. They've been open for only a couple weeks but I don't think many people know since the 2 times I've been there no one was there, for lunch and dinner.

Opening up the menu you can either read the very delicious sounding descriptions or look at the very delicious looking pictures.  You can even ask the very friendly staff if they had any recommendations. I wanted everything and just started ordering, my eyes and my stomach were not on the same page. They have Portuguese chicken livers and giblets, Portuguese sausages, snails and frog legs, various pastas, curries, skewered meats, steaks, seafood, wraps, and desserts. I was told they use less seasoning in some of their food than usual to appeal to the people but they'll make it spicier if you wanted.

The Trinchado, from their menu were "Cubes of meat marinated in red wine, grilled to perfection, cooked with trinchado creamy sauce and olives with pits, served with toasted bread." How do you not order it. It was good. I liked the creamy sauce and meat was perfect. Be aware that the olives are with pits and the pits are no joke when your teeth whack it. I'd order it again. There's an appetizer version and a full meal version.

The Halloumi Cheese, from their menu was "cyrpus grilled goat cheese, served with sweet and sour or peri peri sauce." It was really salty and pretty good. Seems like it would be good with some beer. Eat it right away and don't let it cool down to much cause it gets hard. 

The Dobrada Portuguesa was "slow cooked ox tripe and broiled with mixed cheese." It was my favorite of the 3 items I've ordered. You either like tripe or dislike tripe and I like tripe covering it with cheese makes it even better. The smell is strong.

The interior is nice and clean with a big screen TV. The staff is very friendly and did everything right.

What to expect after I write this review beside my multiple check-ins and picture posting? They're in the process of getting their liquor license. They already have a nice bar area setup as soon as they get to fill it with liquor and serve it up the better. They have what looked like a setup for live music. They have a lot of potential. I'd be back.

This is my first time trying Portuguese seafood and I was impressed, considering by the end of happy hour you're looking at $15-$20 a person.  While it may look more like a locals joint, it taste like it should be a traveler's destination for foodies. They start you off with bread and their special fish egg dill sauce, which is above expectation. The sangria is delicious. $4 gets you two servings unless you're an alcoholic. The chorizo is super flavorful. Mussels were cheesy and savory, though it only comes in three. There's some stranger type meats like snails, ox tripe and deep fried pig ears for the food adventurer. Most of their dishes come in a very well seasoned cheesy white sauce. My favorite would be the shrimp tail.

Yes it's empty, but I believe it's because it's in the wrong neighborhood. It appears causal, but it tastes fancy.

Had dinner last night with my husband at Vila Algarve, what a fabulous treat, don't let the name Portuguese food fool you. Luby the owner greeted us  very pleasant woman, lovely lady           I am a fussy eater and the food was delicious, Caldo Verdi soup was to die for the favor unbelievable and just with the name I would never order it but I went out on the limb to try something different and I knew that my husband would eat it, well it was so good he just got a taste.....lol.....sangria was smooth and hearty, loved it  never thought I would be eating calamari or chorizo, it was grilled to perfection and the favors were unbelievable grill shrimp and pork along with the veggies and rice were also grilled to perfection, I would recommend this restaurant to everyone, we will definitely be back, sorry it took me so long to try it but now that I did it will be a staple on my list of restaurants, so so delicious

Excellent service, really good food, nicer style decor. Safe bet on quality food.

This place was really cool to eat at they have a big menu but they are family owned so
It's a great environment and the
Sangria is better if not best in the valley, and it decently priced. Think
Family style high end, good for
Date night or just late night.

Vila Algarve shares its name (perhaps strangely) with the former headquarters of the Portuguese Secret Police in Mozambique. I always like Portuguese food, but this place is one of my favorites, perhaps because of the influence from Mozambique. The flavors are stronger than most Portuguese, and more complex in a complementary way. There is even a small section of the menu with authentic dishes from Mozambique. Excellent food, although the lack of a liquor license (and by extension Portuguese Green Wine) is too bad. 

Suggestion-wise, I doubt there is Pallela on the entire Iberian Peninsula that comes close. The Bitoque steak and Portuguese Chorizo (Lenguiça) is also excellent. I haven't tried anything from the Mozambique section, but next time I probably will.

Also worth noting is that the atmosphere is kinda weird, but not necessarily in a bad way. I was shorted $5 change, but probably not on purpose.

Please don't look at any of the pictures from the menu when ordering. 

1) their "whole chicken" is actually two wings and two thighs. No breasts. 

2) their side veggies is a salad

3) you are charged a $9 delivery fee

4) my $55 order which I was hoping was good for 3 people was good for one person

I always order delivery, and they are very kind.  The food comes fresh and in a timely manner.  It's always come clean and never messy like some delivery food can be.  Everything tastes great. I'm a very happy customer!

Took a friend here for her birthday.  Place was pretty well empty.  

There's a specials board as soon as you walk in - none of those did it for me but I knew I would be happy with the regular menu, so no big deal.

We started with sangria ($10 during happy hour 3-7, also lots of $4 appetizers) - good stuff.  And the chorizo appetizer - also good stuff.

The meals do take a while to get served so plan on being here a bit (which was fine with us).  We ordered the Algarve chicken and chicken Espetadas - both were really good.  

The waitress couldn't have been nicer and Luby came out to introduce herself, also couldn't have been nicer.

Definitely going to try to make it out here for happy hour more often.

I would go back and would definitely recommend it to friends.

Spectacular.  We just had a pleasant 3-hour meal with friends. Our conversation was never interrupted and we never felt rushed.  We started with halloumi cheese and wine, then had dinner.  Dinner took a while but we were interested in visiting w/friends rather than eating and running.  Finished with a light tiramisu. Everything was wonderful...we are locals who will return.

All the way from Porto portugal lost off love!
Than you lubi great food  and very clean place we loved the this place
The food was great, good snails, the Portuguese chorizo was delicious but the espatada beef was salty.

I was so excited to see that Las Vegas finally had a Portuguese restaurant. It was wonderful and everything was made very fresh! The staff was great as well, which can be hard to find! I ordered their chouriço ,caldo verde( soup with kale, potato, and chouriço), and bacalhau a bras. They were wonderful and very authentic! I look forward to going back to support them and trying more things on the menu.

My wife and I had dinner at Vila Algarve for the first time last night.  We had a wonderful meal.  We started with the grilled goat cheese appetizer which was off the chart.  I had a hanging beef kabob and my wife had salted Cod.  None of these dishes were what we would have normally ordered but our waiter and the owner who came over and introduced herself were very helpful in making recommendations.  The food was delicious and the service was first rate.  We will definitely go back.  Not only was the food great but the prices were very reasonable.  You need to check it out.

You know when you have that gut feeling that you should just chose another place to eat but you ignore it, in this case I wish I had listened. The initial transformation to an 80's cabaret was oddly the least disturbing part of this restaurant. Upon entering we were asked to sign in and "donate" 10 dollars each for the band. In all my dining experience have I ever been asked to pay for the entertainment and the donation was not optional as we were instructed we had to pay before being seated. Ignoring the urge to leave then, we were seated where the waitress explained a few dishes. We never received any bread that is pictured in all of the reviews, the mussels appetizer consisted of 5 total, and cheese appetizer though not bad, was pretty salty. Our entrees did not make up for the poor start. A poor rendition of chucascaria style meat, overly sweet curry shrimp, and completely undressed salads left much to be desired. The mysterious disappearance of our waitress while we anxiously waited for the check to leave immediately was the last nail in the coffin. We will not return and regretfully had to go to a second restaurant that night to remove the bad taste and bad feelings we were left with following this dining experience.

Tried this place while visiting Las Vegas all the way from New Jersey. Hands down, an amazing decision to come here. The service was OUTSTANDING. The waitress/owner (maybe) could tell we were new to the game and so she went through every item and had suggestions. We really felt welcomed! As for the food.. it was all so delicious. I had the homemade pasta with shrimp, mussels, and calamari, which was so fresh and tasty! My friends had homemade pasta with chicken, and the other a 12 oz beef steak.. both were AWESOME! especially the steak, very juicy and cooked just right! Thanks so much for giving us a great place to eat in an unfamiliar town! Highly recommended!
Incredible food. Impeccable service. What a great atmosphere to dine in. My family had a great time. I can't wait to go back.

The service was excellent and the food was delicious and fresh.The paella was succulent but not to juicy just right. The seafood was clean and fresh along with the kale soup with the Portuguese sausage was very tasty. So if your out and wanna try something different come to Vila Algarue Seafood & Grill Portuguese Restaurant Don't forget to try the dip very light and tasty

Wait staff = 5 stars! They were soooo nice!

So I wanted to give this place a 5 star rating, and I wanted to like it as much as the other 5 star ratings. I read the reviews and almost salivated...

The orders here were yummy very much like most of the reviews. But to me, i felt like the dishes were missing a tiny bit of magic.... one dish could of used more herbs, another dish more presentation, another dish more salt, etc.

But don't let the above description fool you. I came back here twice in the week I first tried it. The food is definitely good. The wait staff even better. Also i'm not accustomed to this type of cuisine so therefore my review might be too judgmental.

I just wait there was just a tiny bit more to the flavor, and I'd go for the 5 star rating. Too bad there isn't a 4.5 rating.

We watched a travel show on Portugal today and inspired us to try Portuguese food. I had read about Vila Algarve so tonight seemed a good time to try it. We stared with s glass of the house made sangria; I usually avoid sangria due to high sugar. This was refreshing and not overly sweet. We decided to try some appetizers and share an entree 

First up was the Portuguese chorizo - amazing. Be sure to dip your bread in the peri-peri sauce. Or, just use a spoon - it's that good.  Loved the flaming pig presentation. 

I was dubious on the mussels but boy was I wrong. They were plump and the sauce was flavorful. Again, dip your bread. 

I might be ordering the trinchado as a main instead of an appetizer it was that good. The chicken was moist and the sauce...wait for it...so good you have to sop it up with the toast.  Yes, there's a trend here. 

We shared the seafood paella and our only disappointment was that there was no crispy rice.  The flavor was on point and the serving large. 

We will happily return.
Went with my Portuguese friend. He was very happy.  Great lingusa  and beef. I would recommend it.

Being from one of the Portuguese Food Meca's in the United States one is curious to see whats out there. So we were in Vegas for the weekend decided to see if we could find a Portuguese Restaurant and we discovered on Yelp Vila Algarve so my wife and i decided to check it out. We were greeted by very warm Host Luby which she's the owner / waitress of this fine restaurant she asked if we ever had Portuguese food of course we said since we are Portuguese and live in NJ she smiled and pointed us to our table and recommended few of the specials. My wife had the soup which was the traditional Portuguese Caldo Verde which she says was very delicious and i had the portuguese steak dish with a fried egg on top and fries (Bitoque) with House Sauce - Luby combines the traditional Portuguese and Bulgarian culinary to make these fabulous dishes.  It was great experience and highly recommend for those that are looking for some great home cooking.

Had dinner last night with a friend and we enjoyed it very much. 
We had a nice dinner while people were dancing around us that was very cool. I was expecting dance like tango or what I called "old people dance" but not at all. That was modern music and everybody, any age, was dancing !
The food was fresh and homemade. 
I had Dolmades to start with and that was my first time that they were served hot. I always had them cold. Very good and tasty. 
Had then Potato Algarve with melted cheese on top and salad on the side. 
For desert we shared a kind of chocolate tiramisu that we much appreciated because it was not too sweet at all.

This place is a must visit. The food is devine...literally heaven on a plate. We had the most tenderly cooked food that made us melt. We had the cozido Portuguesa as a starter along with the snails cooked in a creamy Chardonnay sauce topped with mixed cheeses. Followed by the special of the day. Beef cheeks that were so tenderly cooked they literally melted in your mouth. The food acidity was balanced by the creamy wine sauce and fatty components of the tenderly cooked meat. Just like velvet in ones mouth. We'll definitely be back
Great little spot. Food was outstanding. Nice little gem tucked in a strip mall. Steak was great. Snails were excellent. The home sausage was great with an excellent presentation.

As this is the second time we have had Portuguese food, this has been the best experience yet. The staff was nice and friendly and the food was great. I would recommend the snails as an appetizer and the Paella as the main dish. Plus there is also some dancing lessons!

Phenomenal seafood dishes, very fresh and perfectly cooked. We had the seafood platter with Sea bass, calamari, and prawns. The sangria and home made baklava were also excellent. The owner and staff are very friendly and provided excellent service. Highly recommend!!!

I have been here twice within the last month and both times the food had been exceptionally good.  I ordered the trinchado appetizer and algarve chicken before.  The trinchado is so tender and the sauce is extremely tasty you will be asking for more bread to scoop up the rest of the sauce.  My entree was quite tasty as well but I enjoyed the appetizer which they also offer as an entree.  Today my friend and I tried the chorizo appetizer and the snails (escargo).  Chorizo comes out with flames which is a nice presentation and has a nice kick to it which was perfect because I love spicy!  Escargo is served in a creamy white sauce which is different than the traditional way I am used to but very tasty none the less. We also ordered two specials that were not on the menu, fresh prawns never frozen straight from the market marinated and grilled to perfection and the other entree we shared was cow cheek.  Marinated and cooked overnight this beef was so tender it practically melts in your mouth! 

This is also a great place to listen to music whether its a live jazz band or just the mellow DJ music with couples dancing the night away!

The owner was so kind and genuine, showing passion for everything she makes and extremely caring about how and what we thought of each dish she brought to us!  There are not many places left like this! A must try, you won't be disappointed!

This place is amazing!  I started going there on a regular basis about a month ago and everything I have tried on their menu has been incredibly fresh and cooked to order. The staff is wonderful and the service impeccable. The sea food is so fresh as though they just fished it out of the ocean this morning. And the prices are VERY affordable.  It is a family friendly place, great to bring kids to, they made a special cheese pita for my 6 yr old picky eater , that Lubi the owner, suggested and my son loved it! Way to go guys! I know Vila Algarve is going to become one of Las Vegas's top restaurants soon!

This is my second time here. We just came back from dinner and we had the seafood four course meal for two on Groupon for $79.   The food is authentic, freshly prepared Portuguese  cuisine. The owner is very nice and took our order herself, and she explains to us just like the last time that food may take a while as they cook it right then.That was good to know. We also had the flaming chorizo which was fun to experience. My boyfriend's first time here and he was so impressed with the whole experience, great service, delicious fresh food, he was having foodgasm the whole time LOL! 

The Seabass and the Flaming chorizo were grilled just right and the sauce on thw seafood plate were tasty. Also to mention the Portuguese soup was delectable.

They have live dancing every night, and the place and ambience is romantic. It would be good for parties Nd on a date.

Highly recommend this ethnic experience, we will be back!

This place reminded me of a fancy club house in active senior 55+ community in Florida. 
Came here for dinner on Monday. It was their tango night. (you pay $10 and you get tango lesson and buffet.) We didn't know. We didn't come here for tango lesson but everybody else here was in for the tango lesson. The tango teacher, Fred asked us to join the tango, but we are not "tango people" so I said no. We felt very uncomfortable after that.
We ordered Bulgarian salad and Vila platter for two. The waitress and one of the owners Luby was super nice. She explained about all kinds different Portuguese food. She was such a nice person, super nice. I really hate to give her restaurant low star review...

The salad... Fresh tomatoes,  fresh green bell pepper slices, fresh onion slices. Fresh shredded goat cheese on top. Delicious. We enjoyed it.

Vila platter for two... To tiny lobster tail (like you would get in Smith's or Albertsons), six shrimps (tough and hard), about six tiny pieces of calamari(chewy like rubber), two fried cod, two green mussels and tiny portion of white rice. Everything was previously frozen, of course. Even tasted frozen especially the lobster tail. $69.99. Really?!! This dish doesn't even fill one person up. Way over priced. 

We were still hungry after finished the dish but didn't feel like ordering another item after all that experience. If you have active mom or aunt, I'm sure they would enjoy the $10 tango class and the buffet. Tango class till 12 am. We will not return.

(Sometimes my honesty gets me in minor troubles but what's the point of me Yelping if I post dishonest reviews here. Plus if you take honesty from me, there's nothing good left about me anyways.)

Unfortunately, my experience at Vila Algarve did not measure up with the expectations the reviews on Yelp created. While the service was friendly, we walked in at 5pm and the restaurant was completely empty. Because the space is large, it made the experience a little eerie. Only one other table would show up within the hour or so that we were there.

For the food, we tried a cheesy tripe dish, portuguese sausage, and a chicken curry. Whether or not it was a bad night or the food quality has gone down, everything was quite bland. For example, the chicken in the curry tasted good at first, but once getting to the center of the chicken, it was basically tasteless. 

We also got some complimentary bread and oil with balsamic vinegar, but even the bread tasted somewhat stale and flavorless.

I do hope that the restaurant is able to find some success, but I simply wasn't impressed with the food that night. It actually reminds me of one of those restaurant rescue shows - they need to slim down the menu and focus on high quality choices because as of now they touch on too many different cuisines.

Excellent food. Genuine service. A rare find in Las Vegas. 
Will definitely return. 
The menu is unique and everything we tried -excellent.

Nice family owned restaurant! Very friendly and welcoming. The bacalhau a bras was delicious. Huge portions, even for a Portuguese girl! I definitely would recommend this restaurant. I will definitely be back again!

We came here last night and were happily surprised to see tango since we are dancers also. Unfortunately the service and food were terrible.

There was only 1 waitress and the owner and they were clearly overwhelmed. It took 45 mins to receive our appetizer and 1 hr to receive our main course. The main courses were cold so they took them back and recooked with the explanation that they were confused and cooked the wrong meat. 

Our orders finally arrived 1.5 hrs after we ordered and were decent tasting. We asked for our check and it took another 20 mins to receive. 

All in all a nightmare to forget.

I visit this restaurant every time I come to Vegas and I've never had a bad experience. The service is always friendly and warm, if you have any questions, just ask them, they'll answer it for you.
So far I've tried different dishes here: lamb shank, chicken liver, Bacalhau Assado, snails, soup of the day, etc, never disappointed. Also, their Sangria is quite tasty.
P.S: if you like this sort of thing, stop by any day after 8, they have free dance lessons and it's definitely fun to participate.

Food was good. I should have been more daring and gotten the Bacalhau abras. Which if it's anything close to homemade like in Lisbon, Portugal would be delicious. The snail app was really good. Great balance of cream and wine. The service was sort of blunt and pushy for my friends' point of view. It was our first time and didn't have much idea of the menu or what to expect. The idea of Portuguese/French/seafood sounds AMAZING but left us short of our expectations. I was on not impressed but satisfied with the beef espetada (I think that's it).  Also they don't offer complimentary bread. It's $1 per loaf which comes with a dip but it's NOT on the menu. **Also! It was a Saturday night and there were tango classes during dinner which was actually very nice. Enjoyed the music and watching the dancers.

Fantastic, I am so happy to have a Porra Resturant in Vegas. Catemba's and Peri Peri chicken the taste of Mocambique in the USA. Even better the owners lived in South Africa and talk Afrikaans. The chicken Livers and Giblets were stunning and reminded me of fun drunken afternoons in Maputo and Beria. Definitely a place to visit if you like Portuguese food especially with a hint of Africa this is the place for you. Oh Ja don't forgetting the Prego roll's. Munto Obbrigado Pa

Wow, glad I found this place! Tried this place as an early dinner and the place was some what empty. Wasn't sure what to expect. Noticed that the decor was nice and fresh. Very open and spacious area. Could easily accommodate several large parties. Was seated by a very nice blonde lady who was more than happy to make our first time experience amazing. Studying all the pictures on Yelp, I knew exactly what I was going to order. Started with the Portuguese pork sausage that came prepared in a flaming pig dish. The sausage had great flavor and a perfectly crispy flamed char to it. Next dish was the Halloumi cheese which has a great flavor on its own. Add in the spicy sauce to kick the cheese up a notch. Moved on to the escargot in a nice cheesy cream sauce. First time eating snails and got to say they taste like cooked mushrooms. The main dish was the paella. This dish can easily feed two people. Didn't really like the peel and eat shrimp. Made the fingers stained with a yellow color and was very messy. This dish had a few simplistic flavors. Used the sauce from the Halloumi cheese dish to add a spicy flare of flavor. To end the meal, the blonde lady suggested a homemade tiramisu. Happy for the suggestion because it was easily the best tiramisu in Vegas! Great experience that ended with a hug from the blonde lady. Great family feeling experience and can't wait to come back to try the rest of the menu.
Called and a lady picked up and just loudly said Hello and  didn't even address the restaurant name. Yelp said close at 12 am and she said kitchen close 10 pm. Misleading info on Yelp.

Four of us met here for lunch so that we could try several dishes to try Portuguese food.  The owner, Lubka, told us it was the only Portuguese restaurant in Las Vegas.  

We were brought rolls and our drinks came quickly.  We ordered several starters to share.  First was a half chorizo that was cooked with red wine and flame grilled tableside.

Next, we had the dish Halloumi, goat cheese grilled over cypress and served with a sweet and sour sauce. 

Next came the snails cooked with a chardonnay white wine and garlic sauce and broiled with mixed cheeses and served with some toast slices.

Next was Bacalao, a dish made up of salted cod, mashed potatoes, garlic, onions, eggs and extra virgin olive oil and served with a salad of mixed greens.  Lubka (Luby) told us how they treated the salt cod daily with whole milk to remove the saltiness of the cod so it wasn't overpoweringly salty.

Then onto the chicken Trinchado.  The chicken is marinated in red wine and grilled.  It's then put in the Trinchado sauce which had a nice paprika flavor and a small hint of cumin.

Then we had the Calamari curry, a bowl of nicely cooked calamari in a curry sauce that didn't hit you up front but had a nice curry tang after the fact.  It was quite good.  With the calamari, we got rice and a container of chutney.  The flavors complimented each other nicely.

When we thought we had no more room, Luby insisted we have some dessert.  We went with the tiramisu.  It's quite a different looking dish from common tiramisu.  The  ladyfingers weren't like most tiramisu but there was a wonderful chocolate and 
coffee flavor in the ladyfingers and the mascarpone cheese made this a wonderful ending dish.

Service was outstanding for the two hours or so that we were there.  We asked that the dishes not be brought out all at once and they did one at a time.  Luby came to the table and asked if it was OK to start the next dish.  She explained the dishes when she brought them and she was an absolute joy!  She's very proud of her food and she has reason to be proud!  

This was a very memorable lunch with good company, good conversation, excellent food, and outstanding and very pleasant service.  Thanks to LJ and Niyen for the heads up on Vila Algarve.  I certainly expect to come back soon. I have to try some of their chicken livers and gizzards.  We opted not to do the organ meats yesterday.  That omission will be rectified soon!

I really wanted to love this place but there were some problems. To start the sangria is watered down and with it being 20 bucks, it is not worth 5 in my opinion.

The snails have a garlicky cheese sauce and were amazing, must try.  

In an attempt to find a cheese I had in Portugal I got their grilled cheese with the peri peri sauce.  It's not bad worth a try.

Sardines, one of the waitresses recommended adding balsamic to these and wow it was great.

The gizzards with a gravy, now these are chicken gizzards and have a beef tasting gravy.  It really didn't do it for me.  Beef and chicken two separate flavors that need to be separate.

The paella well it was soupy and tomato based need I say more.

I just had the best dinner at Villa Algarve. The ambiance is wonderful, open, clean with twinkling lights that add the atmosphere of romance.
The owner is welcoming and delightful. You get the experience of dining in an elegant, European restaurant. Most of all, the food was wonderful! I ordered the Chicken Curry that was beautifully served with saffron rice laced with cooked, dices, fresh carrots, peas and parsley. The chicken was smothered in the most wonderful curry sauce I have ever tasted. 
To make matters even better, the owner is planning themed dance nights starting in February hosting local dance teachers to bring the crowd to the dance floor. A lovely dinner will turn into a social event. I plan to become a regular! You should too!

Had dinner last night at this little gem of a restaurant, than 10 minutes from the Strip.  Place was nice, service was great, food was excellent.  We had 5 tapas appetizers; escargot,  pig ears, calamari, frog legs and Halloumi cheese, all were great except for the pig ears which we never had before and found out we didn't like them.  We split a lamb shank dinner which was excellent.  Total for our meal, including a bottle of wine, was less than $80.00.  Next time in Las Vegas we will definitely go back.   Give it a try, you will not be disappointed.

I don't usually give 5 stars at restaurants but this family owned and operated gem is deserving!  First off my husband and I usually have lunch around 2 to 3pm on our days off together! Which means we're dining in an almost empty restaurant or surrounded by geriatrics. Today we have had the whole restaurant to ourselves!  We'd love to see this place during a busy dinner service though! We started with salads, I chose the Portuguese salad and Darin chose Bulgarian salad. Both were very good! The lovely blonde lady (we think is the owner) brought us samples of a Portuguese wine that was exactly like she decried for us. Can't remember the name, sorry. We ordered the salmon and shared it at our hostesses recommendation. It was really good! We'll be back for sure!

If your reading this your already missing out!!

Bookmarking Vila a few weeks back I finally got here to an empty restaurant! I thought it was a little strange, that was until we met the Lubka!!! That's where our experience took off!!! After being sat and shown the menus we decided to go with all recommendations from the waitress and owner.

Starting off with some great house made sangria we ordered the Portuguese Chorizo and Snails! Wow..... These 2 starters we're simply brilliant, full of flavor and cooked to perfection. Highly recommended!!!

For our mains we ordered Portuguese Steak and Paella Portuguese style. Both were great, my favorite  had to be the Paella. It seemed a little like a southern style dish I've had before just with out the spice.

Now this is where Vila Algarve shines from the menu Desert: Mascarpone and Home Make Cake.... I don't know how to explain these 2, other than Epic!!!! I'm dead serious Epic!!! Texture, flavor and simply outstanding!! 

I would also like to say Vila is a very kid friendly restaurant with High chairs and a small menu for kids. The staff were fantastic with my one year old. Also they said they encourage people to bring along there little ones.

Also after 8pm they have some nice love music. I did say at the start of this review it was empty, once 7p came around the place started filling up quick.

This restaurant is going to take off!!! Having a very international staff and grounding in what it takes to make genuine European food, Vila Algarve is high end food with group and family like atmosphere...

5 stars
This place is fabulous!  Came with a Groupon, but didn't realize that in addition to traditional Portuguese fare they have live entertainment in the form of ballroom dancing.  Very cool!

WOW!!!  finding gems like this is why i love Yelp!  

Vila Algrave has something for everyone!  I'm doing low-carb, and was easy to find friendly dishes for my diet.  A friend, who is a much more adventurous eater, loved the options of chicken liver, chicken giblets, pig ear, tripe, and more!  

We went in last Friday at 7:30.  One diner inside and a group of guys enjoying the patio seating.  As others have stated, everything is made fresh or in-house, so expect to take 1.5-2 hours for your meal.  Luby, the owner, was thorough in explaining the preparation and flavors of all the dishes.   Also, almost everything is grilled, adding another level of flavor.

The Portuguese Chorizo presentation is amazing, and tasted very good; it's different than Mexican chorizo.  The Algarve jumbo shrimps (12 of them!) came hanging on a skewer, much like a Brazilian steakhouse.  Their grilled flavor and the Chardonnay garlic sauce worked very well together. For the entree I had the Espetada 12-Oz-marinade, four pieces of sirloin in a slightly salty marinade.  I used some of the Chardonnay garlic sauce to cut the saltiness.  The girls swooned over the Algarve Mascarpone roll!  I believe they both used "Mouthgasm" to describe the dessert.

This place will get busy once people discover it, and we will be back to try some more things on the menu!
